snippet.textDisplay:
Never played the game before, got a glimpse of it a little but I was probably a little less than 10 years old. I'm 23 now.

But I will never the soundtracks that I deliberately repeated over and over as I played Zelda (because I don't like their 8-bit soundtrack back then lol). I lost the files and back then we didn't have Internet on our computer since it was kind of luxurious. Now that I have fiber optic connection at home, I come back for their songs every now and then.

I love the sound of the fingers against the guitar's nylon, the clear picks of every melody, the chords they used, and the simple melodies that are played on the piano. It's just pure instrumental music.
snippet.textOriginal:
Never played the game before, got a glimpse of it a little but I was probably a little less than 10 years old. I'm 23 now.

But I will never the soundtracks that I deliberately repeated over and over as I played Zelda (because I don't like their 8-bit soundtrack back then lol). I lost the files and back then we didn't have Internet on our computer since it was kind of luxurious. Now that I have fiber optic connection at home, I come back for their songs every now and then.

I love the sound of the fingers against the guitar's nylon, the clear picks of every melody, the chords they used, and the simple melodies that are played on the piano. It's just pure instrumental music.

snippet.textDisplay:
Fellow Cross fan here. 
I've tried my best to love Trigger. I've played through a lot of it, never finished it. I just grow bored of it and quit.
I am glad I played Cross first.

snippet.textDisplay: +xOmniCloudx Agreed, I'm one of the few that likes Cross more than Trigger. As its been said many times before, the hype of Trigger was just too much for Cross to live up to, but by all means, it may not be a great CHRONO game, but it's still one hell of a classic RPG!
snippet.textOriginal: +xOmniCloudx Agreed, I'm one of the few that likes Cross more than Trigger. As its been said many times before, the hype of Trigger was just too much for Cross to live up to, but by all means, it may not be a great CHRONO game, but it's still one hell of a classic RPG!

snippet.textDisplay: This is my all-time favorite game. However, I can see why it would be a disappointment to Trigger fans as the game definitely has a much different feel from that game.
snippet.textOriginal: This is my all-time favorite game. However, I can see why it would be a disappointment to Trigger fans as the game definitely has a much different feel from that game.

snippet.textDisplay: Interesting. FF games are released in sequential order: FF 1, then FF 2 all the way through 14, yet each world is unique and players expect a different experience with each game. Chrono Cross is not a numbered sequel, as in Chrono Trigger 2, yet everyone compares them even though the two are radically different. The battle system, the narrative direction, the ambience, and oh my god, the music! CC may not have the most epic battle music, but this is the most relaxing piece of VGM I've ever heard:)
snippet.textOriginal: Interesting. FF games are released in sequential order: FF 1, then FF 2 all the way through 14, yet each world is unique and players expect a different experience with each game. Chrono Cross is not a numbered sequel, as in Chrono Trigger 2, yet everyone compares them even though the two are radically different. The battle system, the narrative direction, the ambience, and oh my god, the music! CC may not have the most epic battle music, but this is the most relaxing piece of VGM I've ever heard:)

snippet.textDisplay: Chrono Cross is far from my favorite game of all time, but it is my favorite soundtrack of all time. I've expressed it to my gamer friends and associates as well, and challenged them to give me a better soundtrack. They've never been able to. Maybe for them some other soundtrack is better, but for me personally, it does not get any better than this. It's so good that I don't know enough words to express how good it is.
snippet.textOriginal: Chrono Cross is far from my favorite game of all time, but it is my favorite soundtrack of all time. I've expressed it to my gamer friends and associates as well, and challenged them to give me a better soundtrack. They've never been able to. Maybe for them some other soundtrack is better, but for me personally, it does not get any better than this. It's so good that I don't know enough words to express how good it is.

snippet.textDisplay: I doubt I have listened to any OST more than this one.  As an overall soundtrack, this has got to have the most spirit behind it.  Now, I am biased as Chrono Cross is in my top 3 games of all time, but the music has to be some of the most passionate work for any game.  Even with all the praise it gets, this OST is still underrated.
snippet.textOriginal: I doubt I have listened to any OST more than this one.  As an overall soundtrack, this has got to have the most spirit behind it.  Now, I am biased as Chrono Cross is in my top 3 games of all time, but the music has to be some of the most passionate work for any game.  Even with all the praise it gets, this OST is still underrated.

snippet.textDisplay: Agreed. I can listen to so many tracks form that score over and over again. The battle theme is not my favorite at all, but listening to the score, you can skip that track, and then you have perfection.
snippet.textOriginal: Agreed. I can listen to so many tracks form that score over and over again. The battle theme is not my favorite at all, but listening to the score, you can skip that track, and then you have perfection.

snippet.textDisplay:
I never understood how a game like this would have near 10/10s rated across the board, yet was absolutely scorned by some fans. But after hearing the theories and proof of its connections to Chrono Trigger, I can now see why.
It's a shame. If Square hadn't given it the Chrono series title and instead something else, this game would most definitely not be so hatefully remembered.
snippet.textOriginal:
I never understood how a game like this would have near 10/10s rated across the board, yet was absolutely scorned by some fans. But after hearing the theories and proof of its connections to Chrono Trigger, I can now see why.
It's a shame. If Square hadn't given it the Chrono series title and instead something else, this game would most definitely not be so hatefully remembered.

snippet.textDisplay: Probably the best game I was disappointed with. My expectations following the masterpiece that was Chrono Trigger were simply too high and probably clouded my judgement at the time. It's a big reason why I'll have to replay it someday and give it a better chance. I did like the game, just not as much as many. It's funny how such a top notch soundtrack ended up having one of my least favorite battle themes in an RPG.
snippet.textOriginal: Probably the best game I was disappointed with. My expectations following the masterpiece that was Chrono Trigger were simply too high and probably clouded my judgement at the time. It's a big reason why I'll have to replay it someday and give it a better chance. I did like the game, just not as much as many. It's funny how such a top notch soundtrack ended up having one of my least favorite battle themes in an RPG.

snippet.textDisplay: I think I had the benefit of only KNOWING CT when I played CC. I went back and played it on PS1 in a collection with FFVI I purchased one year. I agree that it's one of the worst battle themes. Not because the instrumentation, I just it's all over the place, and It's a song that you do have to hear a LOT. I do not think it would've been as jarring had it been a once in a while fight theme/specific boss battle, or something like that. Aside form that battle theme, I think CC has one of the best soundtracks of all time. I come back to it time and time again. The other tracks are just that good. Especially when paired with some of the great locations that exist in that game.
snippet.textOriginal: I think I had the benefit of only KNOWING CT when I played CC. I went back and played it on PS1 in a collection with FFVI I purchased one year. I agree that it's one of the worst battle themes. Not because the instrumentation, I just it's all over the place, and It's a song that you do have to hear a LOT. I do not think it would've been as jarring had it been a once in a while fight theme/specific boss battle, or something like that. Aside form that battle theme, I think CC has one of the best soundtracks of all time. I come back to it time and time again. The other tracks are just that good. Especially when paired with some of the great locations that exist in that game.

snippet.textDisplay: +allthatishere while the remake is more approachable and they did a good job with the soundtrack, i felt the 3d graphics were muddy and didn't do the game justice. I think really good 8bit graphics are better than meh 3D. If you can stomach it, i recommend playing the original one day.
snippet.textOriginal: +allthatishere while the remake is more approachable and they did a good job with the soundtrack, i felt the 3d graphics were muddy and didn't do the game justice. I think really good 8bit graphics are better than meh 3D. If you can stomach it, i recommend playing the original one day.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky If only they hadn't ditched the ATB system that square had perfected so well, the game would have been a lot easier to get through. Oh and changing the regular exp system for some bullshit leveling up system did not help either. To make matters worse they had this trend since Xenogears and continued with in future games. Why fix what isn't broken? why do the japanese hate the ATB system, why?
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky If only they hadn't ditched the ATB system that square had perfected so well, the game would have been a lot easier to get through. snippet.textDisplay: @drunyon214 Yeah. It may have been a good song, but it wasn't a good Chrono Cross song, which can actually sum up my thoughts about entire games (Breath of Fire: Dragon Quarter, for example).

snippet.textDisplay: @*****  Wow, you didn't play a game because of one song? Thats a first for me see someone say. Thats almost as shallow as the, "This game has bad graphics so it sucks" argument i see so common nowadays.

snippet.textDisplay: I didn't mind the normal battle theme. It wasn't a tune I loved or would listen to apart from the game, unlike almost every other theme in the game... so yeah, by that reasoning, it's arguably the worst song in the game. But I didn't dislike it either; the battle theme never bothered me.
snippet.textOriginal: I didn't mind the normal battle theme. It wasn't a tune I loved or would listen to apart from the game, unlike almost every other theme in the game... so yeah, by that reasoning, it's arguably the worst song in the game. But I didn't dislike it either; the battle theme never bothered me.

snippet.textDisplay: @***** I'm sure  some people didn't like it. That doesn't mean it's going to be changed tho. And why would that have been the case anyways? Just because you complain about something, doesn't mean its going to be changed. Look at all the people that complained about the FF13 series.
snippet.textOriginal: @***** I'm sure  some people didn't like it. That doesn't mean it's going to be changed tho. And why would that have been the case anyways? Just because you complain about something, doesn't mean its going to be changed. Look at all the people that complained about the FF13 series.

snippet.textDisplay: @***** You may not like Gale (the normal battle theme), but you have to admit that the other four battle themes (Between Life and Death, Prisoner of Fate, Fate - The God of Destiny, and Dragon God) are fantastic, right?
snippet.textOriginal: @***** You may not like Gale (the normal battle theme), but you have to admit that the other four battle themes (Between Life and Death, Prisoner of Fate, Fate - The God of Destiny, and Dragon God) are fantastic, right?

snippet.textDisplay: @drunyon214 I have to respectfully disagree with the fact that this game has a better soundtrack than FF VII.  I will give that the sound quality for this soundtrack is much better, but I honestly think that this soundtrack is too light-hearted in some places.  Plus, Mitsuda was still developing his sound since his first big gig as a composer came 5 years prior to making this soundtrack.  Still a good soundtrack though.
snippet.textOriginal: @drunyon214 I have to respectfully disagree with the fact that this game has a better soundtrack than FF VII.  I will give that the sound quality for this soundtrack is much better, but I honestly think that this soundtrack is too light-hearted in some places.  Plus, Mitsuda was still developing his sound since his first big gig as a composer came 5 years prior to making this soundtrack.  Still a good soundtrack though.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm surprised. I love the battle theme for this game because it takes such a weird ensemble of instruments into action. You have a crazy violin with bass and an offset drum with a electric piano going crazy. Really gives the feel that fighting is hectic and a huge contrast from the exploration music the world gives.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm surprised. I love the battle theme for this game because it takes such a weird ensemble of instruments into action. You have a crazy violin with bass and an offset drum with a electric piano going crazy. Really gives the feel that fighting is hectic and a huge contrast from the exploration music the world gives.
